content: mclace shawl designed by lisa hounshell this pattern uses breakaway crochet method techniques if you haven t done so already please refer to the following instructional material before attempting this pattern for more information on the breakaway crochet method in general please visit the website for a demonstration of techniques used in this specific project please watch this youtube video materials yarn 5 balls hjertegran new arezzo sport / 5 ply each ball = 164 yards / 150 meters 1 76 ounces / 50 grams hook us size e4 / 3 5 mm measurements width = 15 / 38 cm length = 55 / 140 cm gauge in single_crochet 20 sts x 24 row = 4 / 10 cm 1 abbreviations us terminology slip_stitch slip_stitch chain chain stitch single_crochet single_crochet fsc floating single_crochet - make a floating ring yarn over and pull through 2 loops on hook fr floating ring mw mini wheel - a small motif that is either worked all at once or in stages when completed it consists of a fsc and 7 single crochets sq square - a group of 16 mini wheels 4 x 4 the shawl as shown here is 4 x 13 sqs vch vertical chain pattern notes this shawl is rectangular in shape consisting of squares sqs that are made up of 16 mini wheels 3 chain stitches separate the mini wheels within each square and 6 chain stitches separate each square a set of sqs means a row of 4 sqs the first sq on the left edge will have incomplete mws the shawl is 4 sqs wide by 13 sqs long but this is easy to modify if you desire your shawl to be a different size when working the shawl you will start with a setup row that establishes the pattern after that you will be alternating between a return row and a foundation row after a set of sqs have been worked you will work a tall foundation row instead of a normal foundation row to start the next set of sqs once all 13 sets of sqs have been worked then you will work what is essentially a return row along the left edge of the shawl to finish the remaining mws 2 instructions note unloaded otherwise stated all single crochets are worked into the most recently made floating ring step 1 setup row worked from left to right fsc 7sc slip_stitch in next st ch3 fsc 7sc slip_stitch around ch3 ch3 fsc single_crochet ch3 slip_stitch into 10th st behind the hook ch3 2 times fsc 7sc slip_stitch around ch3 ch3 fsc single_crochet ch3 slip_stitch into 10th st behind the hook ch6 *begin next sq fsc 7sc slip_stitch around ch3 ch3 fsc single_crochet ch3 slip_stitch into 10th st behind the hook ch3 3 times fsc 7sc slip_stitch around ch3 ch3 fsc single_crochet ch3 slip_stitch into 10th st behind the hook ch6 repeat from * 1 more time begin last sq fsc 7sc slip_stitch around ch3 ch3 fsc
